arm_group.description: Delefilcon A contact lenses worn for 16 waking hours in Period 1, followed by 15 minutes of wear in Period 2.  Both products worn bilaterally in daily wear, daily disposable mode.
Delefilcon A contact lenses worn for 15 minutes in Period 1, followed by 16 waking hours of wear in Period 2.  Both products worn bilaterally in daily wear, daily disposable mode.

brief_summary.textblock:
The primary objective of the study is to demonstrate that the lubricity of DAILIES Total1®
      (DT1) lenses after 16 hours of wear is equivalent to the lubricity of unworn DT1 lenses.

detailed_description.textblock:
In this crossover study, participants will attend 3 visits. Each participant will wear study
      lenses for 2 specified time periods (16 hours and 15 minutes, treatment sequence randomized)
      following which lenses will be collected for ex vivo lubricity analysis. The ex vivo
      lubricity analysis will be evaluated under a separate non-clinical protocol.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Willing and able to sign Informed Consent document.

          -  Adapted, current soft contact lens wearer.

          -  Requires contact lens powers within the specified range of -0.50 to -10.00 diopters
             (D).

          -  Cylinder between 0.00D and -1.00D (inclusive) in both eyes at Visit 1 manifest
             refraction.

          -  Vision correctable to 20/25 or better in each eye at distance with study lenses.

          -  Willing to wear study lenses at least 16 waking hours in one day and attend all study
             visits.

          -  Able to be successfully fitted with study lenses.

          -  Other protocol-specified inclusion criteria may apply.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Any ocular infection, inflammation, abnormality or active disease that would
             contraindicate contact lens wear, as determined by the Investigator.

          -  Use of systemic or ocular medications for which contact lens wear could be
             contraindicated, as determined by the Investigator.

          -  Use of artificial tears and rewetting drops during the study.

          -  Monocular (only one eye with functional vision) or fit with only one lens.

          -  Any abnormal ocular condition observed during the Visit 1 slit lamp examination.

          -  History of herpetic keratitis, ocular surgery, or irregular cornea.

          -  Pregnant.

          -  Participation in any clinical study within 30 days of Visit 1.

          -  Other protocol-specified exclusion criteria may apply.

intervention.description: Silicone hydrogel contact lenses, worn and unworn

facility.name: Contact Alcon Call Center for Trial Locations

clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Lubricity of DAILIES Total1® Contact Lenses After Wear

primary_outcome.description: Worn contact lenses will be removed from the participant's eye and the CF will be measured. A lower CF may indicate higher contact lens lubricity.
primary_outcome.measure: Average Coefficient of Friction (CF) for worn lenses at 16 hours (CF16)

primary_outcome.description: Unworn contact lenses will be removed from the commercial packaging and the CF of the unworn lenses will be measured. A lower CF may indicate higher contact lens lubricity.
primary_outcome.measure: Average Coefficient of Friction (CF) for unworn lenses (CFuw)

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Worn contact lenses will be removed from the participant's eye and the CF will be measured. A lower CF may indicate higher contact lens lubricity.
secondary_outcome.measure: Average Coefficient of Friction (CF) for worn lenses at 15 minutes (CF15)

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Crossover Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Outcomes Assessor)
